00063 /**
00064    ## FUNCTION:
00065         init_def_dparams
00066   
00067    ## SPECIFICATION:
00068         Initialisation of default parameters.
00069   
00070    ## PARAMETRES: void
00071   
00072    ## RETURN: 
00073         s_dparams*: Pointer to allocated paramers.
00074   
00075 */
00076 s_dparams* init_def_dparams(void)
00077 {
00078         s_dparams *par = (s_dparams*) my_malloc(sizeof(s_dparams)) ;
00079 
00080         par->f_exp = (char *)my_malloc(M_MAX_FILE_NAME_LENGTH*sizeof(char)) ;
00081         par->f_fpckp = (char *)my_malloc(M_MAX_FILE_NAME_LENGTH*sizeof(char)) ;
00082         par->f_fpcknp = (char *)my_malloc(M_MAX_FILE_NAME_LENGTH*sizeof(char)) ;
00083 
00084         strcpy(par->f_exp, M_OUTPUT_FILE1_DEFAULT) ;
00085         strcpy(par->f_fpckp, M_OUTPUT_FILE2_DEFAULT) ;
00086         strcpy(par->f_fpcknp, M_OUTPUT_FILE3_DEFAULT) ;
00087 
00088         par->fcomplex = NULL ;
00089         par->ligs = NULL ;
00090         par->nfiles = 0 ;
00091         par->interface_dist_crit = M_VERT_LIG_NEIG_DIST ;
00092         par->interface_method = M_INTERFACE_METHOD1 ;
00093 
00094         return par ;
00095 }
00096 
00097 /**
00098    ## FUNCTION: 
00099         get_dpocket_args
00100   
00101    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00102         This function analyse the user's command line and parse it to store 
00103         parameters for the descriptor calculator programm.
00104   
00105    ## PARAMETRES:
00106         @ int nargs   : Number of arguments
00107         @ char **args : Arguments of main program
00108   
00109    ## RETURN:
00110         s_dparams*: Pointer to parameters
00111   
00112 */
00113 s_dparams* get_dpocket_args(int nargs, char **args)
00114 {
00115         int i,
00116                 status = 0,
00117                 nstats = 0 ;
00118         
00119         char *str_list_file = NULL ;
00120 
00121         s_dparams *par = init_def_dparams() ;
00122         par->fpar = get_fpocket_args(nargs, args) ;
00123         
00124         /* Read arguments by flags */
00125         for (i = 1; i < nargs; i++) {
00126                 if (strlen(args[i]) == 2 && args[i][0] == '-') {
00127                         switch (args[i][1]) {
00128                                 case M_DPAR_DISTANCE_CRITERIA : 
00129                                                 if(i < nargs-1) status += parse_dist_crit(args[++i], par) ;
00130                                                 else {
00131                                                         fprintf(stdout, "! Distance criteria defining the protein-ligand interface is missing.\n") ;
00132                                                         status += 1 ;
00133                                                 } 
00134                                                 break ;
00135 
00136                                 case M_DPAR_INTERFACE_METHOD1 :
00137                                                 par->interface_method = M_INTERFACE_METHOD1 ;
00138                                                 par->interface_dist_crit = M_VERT_LIG_NEIG_DIST ;
00139                                                 break ;
00140 
00141                                 case M_DPAR_INTERFACE_METHOD2 :
00142                                                 par->interface_method = M_INTERFACE_METHOD2 ; 
00143                                                 par->interface_dist_crit = M_LIG_NEIG_DIST ;
00144                                                 break ;
00145 
00146                                 case M_DPAR_OUTPUT_FILE : 
00147                                                 if(nstats >= 1) fprintf(stdout, "! More than one single file for the stats output file has been given. Ignoring this one.\n") ;
00148                                                 else {
00149                                                         if(i < nargs-1) {
00150                                                                 if(strlen(args[++i]) < M_MAX_FILE_NAME_LENGTH) {
00151                                                                         remove_ext(args[i]) ;
00152                                                                         sprintf(par->f_exp, "%s_exp.txt", args[i]) ;
00153                                                                         sprintf(par->f_fpckp, "%s_fp.txt", args[i]) ;
00154                                                                         sprintf(par->f_fpcknp, "%s_fpn.txt", args[i]) ;
00155                                                                 }
00156                                                                 else fprintf(stdout, "! Output file name is too long... Keeping default.") ;
00157                                                         }
00158                                                         else {
00159                                                                 fprintf(stdout, "! Invalid output file name argument missing.\n") ;
00160                                                                 status += 1 ;
00161                                                         }
00162                                                 }
00163                                                 break ;
00164 
00165                                 case M_DPAR_INPUT_FILE : 
00166                                                 if(i < nargs-1) str_list_file = args[++i] ;
00167                                                 else {
00168                                                         fprintf(stdout, "! Input file name argument missing.\n") ;
00169                                                         status += 1 ; 
00170                                                 }
00171                                                  break ;
00172 
00173                                 default:
00174                                         //  Check fpocket parameters!
00175                                         if(!is_fpocket_opt(args[i][1])) {
00176                                                 fprintf(stdout, "> Unknown option '%s'. Ignoring it.\n",
00177                                                                 args[i]) ;
00178                                         }
00179                                         break ;
00180                         }
00181                 }
00182         }
00183 
00184         if(status > 0) {
00185                 free_dparams(par) ;
00186                 par = NULL ;
00187                 print_dpocket_usage(stdout);
00188         }
00189         else {
00190                 if(str_list_file) {
00191                         int res = add_list_complexes(str_list_file, par) ;
00192                         if(res <= 0) {
00193                                 fprintf(stdout, "! No data has been read.\n") ;
00194                                 free_dparams(par) ;
00195                                 par = NULL ;
00196                                 print_dpocket_usage(stdout);
00197                         }
00198                 }       
00199                 else {
00200                         fprintf(stdout, "! No input file given... Try again :).\n") ;
00201                         free_dparams(par) ;
00202                         par = NULL ;
00203                         print_dpocket_usage(stdout);
00204                 }
00205         }
00206 
00207         return par;
00208 }

00210 /**
00211    ## FUNCTION: 
00212         add_list_complexes
00213   
00214    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00215         Load a list of protein-ligand pdb file path. This file should have the 
00216         following format:
00217 
00218         complex_pdb_file        ligand_code
00219         complex_pdb_file2       ligand_code2
00220         complex_pdb_file3       ligand_code3
00221         (...)
00222  
00223         Each complexe-ligand set will be stored in the parameters structure.
00224   
00225    ## PARAMETRES:
00226         @ char *str_list_file : Path of the file containing all data
00227         @ s_dparams *par      : Structures that stores all thoses files
00228   
00229    ## RETURN: 
00230         int: Number of file read.
00231   
00232 */
00233 int add_list_complexes(char *str_list_file, s_dparams *par) 
00234 {
00235         FILE *f;
00236         int n,
00237                 nread = 0,
00238                 status ;
00239 
00240         char buf[M_MAX_PDB_NAME_LEN*2 + 6],
00241                  complexbuf[M_MAX_PDB_NAME_LEN],
00242                  ligbuf[5];
00243 
00244         /* Loading data. */
00245         f = fopen(str_list_file, "r") ;
00246 /*
00247         printf(str_list_file);
00248 */
00249         if(f) {
00250                 while(fgets(buf, 210, f)) {
00251 /*
00252                         printf("B: %s\n" , buf);
00253 */
00254                         n = par->nfiles ;
00255                         status = sscanf(buf, "%s\t%s", complexbuf, ligbuf) ;
00256 
00257                         if(status < 2) {
00258 /*
00259                                 fprintf(stderr, "! Skipping row '%s' with bad format (status %d).\n",
00260                                                                 buf, status) ;
00261 */
00262                         }
00263                         else {
00264 /*
00265                                 printf("%s %s\n", complexbuf, ligbuf );
00266 */
00267                                 nread += add_complexe(complexbuf, ligbuf, par) ;
00268                         }
00269                         
00270                 }
00271         }
00272         else {
00273                 fprintf(stderr, "! File %s doesn't exists\n", str_list_file) ;
00274         }
00275 
00276         return nread ;
00277 }
00278 
00279 /**
00280    ## FUNCTION: 
00281         add_complexe
00282   
00283    ## SPECIFICATION:    
00284         Add a set of data to the list of set of data in the parameters. this function
00285         is used for the tpocket program only.
00286         
00287         The function will try to open the file, and data will be stored only if the
00288         file exists, and if the name of the ligand is valid.
00289   
00290    ## PARAMETERS:
00291         @ char *apo     : The apo path
00292         @ char *complex : The complex path
00293         @ char *ligan   : The ligand resname: a 4 letter (max!) 
00294         @ s_dparams *par: The structure than contains parameters.
00295   
00296    ## RETURN: 
00297         int: 1 if everything is OK, 0 if not.
00298   
00299 */
00300 int add_complexe(char *complex, char *ligand, s_dparams *par) 
00301 {
00302         int nm1, i, l ;
00303 
00304         FILE *f = fopen_pdb_check_case(complex, "r") ;
00305         if(f) {
00306                 l = strlen(ligand) ;
00307                 if(strlen(ligand) >= 2) {
00308                         for(i = 0 ; i < l ; i++) ligand[i] = toupper(ligand[i]) ;
00309 
00310                         nm1 = par->nfiles ;
00311                         par->nfiles += 1 ;
00312 
00313                         par->ligs   = (char**) my_realloc(par->ligs, (par->nfiles)*sizeof(char*)) ;
00314                         par->fcomplex = (char**) my_realloc(par->fcomplex, (par->nfiles)*sizeof(char*)) ;
00315         
00316                         par->fcomplex[nm1] = (char *)my_malloc((strlen(complex)+1)*sizeof(char)) ;
00317                         par->ligs[nm1]   = (char *)my_malloc((strlen(ligand)+1)*sizeof(char)) ;
00318         
00319                         strcpy(par->fcomplex[nm1], complex) ;
00320                         strcpy(par->ligs[nm1], ligand) ;
00321         
00322                         fclose(f) ;
00323                 }
00324                 else {
00325                         fprintf(stdout, "! The name given for the ligand is invalid or absent.\n") ;
00326                         fclose(f) ;
00327                         return 0 ;
00328                 }
00329                 
00330         }
00331         else {
00332                 fprintf(stdout, "! The pdb file '%s' doesn't exists.\n", complex) ;
00333                 return 0 ;
00334         }
00335 
00336         return 1 ;
00337 }
00338 
00339 /**
00340    ## FUNCTION: 
00341         parse_dist_crit
00342   
00343    ## SPECIFICATION:    
00344         Parsing function for the distance criteria defining the protein-ligand 
00345         interface.
00346   
00347    ## PARAMETERS:
00348         @ char *str    : The string to parse
00349         @ s_dparams *p : The structure than will contain the parsed parameter
00350   
00351    ## RETURN: 
00352         0 if the parameter is valid (here a valid integer), 1 if not
00353   
00354 */
00355 int parse_dist_crit(char *str, s_dparams *p) 
00356 {
00357         if(str_is_float(str, M_NO_SIGN)) {
00358                 p->interface_dist_crit = (float) atof(str) ;
00359         }
00360         else {
00361                 fprintf(stdout, "! Invalid value (%s) given for the distance criteria defining the protein-ligand interface.\n", str) ;
00362                 return 1 ;
00363         }
00364 
00365         return 0 ;
00366 }
00367 
00368 /**
00369    ## FUNCTION: 
00370         print_dparams
00371   
00372    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00373         Print function, usefull to debug
00374   
00375    ## PARAMETRES:
00376         @ s_dparams *p : The structure than will contain the parsed parameter
00377         @ FILE *f      : The file to write in
00378   
00379    ## RETURN: 
00380     void
00381   
00382 */
00383 void print_dparams(s_dparams *p, FILE *f)
00384 {
00385 
00386         if(p) {
00387                 fprintf(f, "==============\nParameters of the program: \n");
00388                 int i ;
00389                 for(i = 0 ; i < p->nfiles ; i++) {
00390                         fprintf(f, "> Protein %d: '%s', '%s'\n", i+1, p->fcomplex[i], p->ligs[i]) ;
00391                 }
00392                 
00393                 if(p->interface_method == M_INTERFACE_METHOD1) 
00394                         fprintf(f, "> Method used to define explicitely the interface atoms: contacted atom by alpha spheres.\n") ; 
00395                 else fprintf(f, "> Method used to define explicitely the interface atoms: ligand's neighbors.\n") ;
00396                 
00397                 fprintf(f, "> Distance used to define explicitely the interface: %f.\n", 
00398                                         p->interface_dist_crit) ;
00399                 
00400                 fprintf(f, "==============\n");
00401         }
00402         else fprintf(f, "> No parameters detected\n");
00403 }

00407         print_dparams_usage
00408   
00409    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00410         Displaying usage of the programm in the given buffer
00411   
00412    ## PARAMETRES:
00413         @ FILE *f: buffer to print in
00414   
00415    ## RETURN: 
00416   
00417 */
00418 void print_dpocket_usage(FILE *f)
00419 {
00420         f = (f == NULL) ? stdout:f ;
00421 
00422         fprintf(f, M_DP_USAGE) ;
00423 }

00425 /**
00426    ## FUNCTION: 
00427         free_params
00428   
00429    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00430         Free parameters
00431   
00432    ## PARAMETRES: 
00433         @ s_dparams *p: Pointer to the structure to free
00434   
00435    ## RETURN: 
00436         void
00437   
00438 */
00439 void free_dparams(s_dparams *p)
00440 {
00441         if(p) {
00442                 if(p->ligs) {
00443                         my_free(p->ligs) ;
00444                         p->ligs = NULL ;
00445                 }
00446 
00447                 if(p->fcomplex) {
00448                         my_free(p->fcomplex) ;
00449                         p->fcomplex = NULL ;
00450                 }
00451                 
00452                 if(p->f_exp) {
00453                         my_free(p->f_exp) ;
00454                         p->f_exp = NULL ;
00455                 }
00456 
00457                 if(p->f_fpckp) {
00458                         my_free(p->f_fpckp) ;
00459                         p->f_fpckp = NULL ;
00460                 }
00461 
00462                 if(p->f_fpcknp) {
00463                         my_free(p->f_fpcknp) ;
00464                         p->f_fpcknp = NULL ;
00465                 }
00466 
00467                 free_fparams(p->fpar) ;
00468 
00469                 my_free(p) ;
00470         }
00471 }
